sentences: Tuleb j채lle jalad selga v천tta ja minna.
V천tku ruttu jalad kaenlasse ja mingu kohapakkuja jutule.
Pole muud kui jalad selga ja linna.
context: In Estonian, 'selga' is the partitive singular form of 'selg', which means 'back'. It's commonly used in phrases like 'jalad selga v천tta' (to take feet on back/shoulders - meaning to carry someone piggyback). The word refers to the back part of the body or can be used metaphorically for carrying someone on one's back.
